Class JPopupButton

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class JPopupButton
extends javax.swing.JButton

JPopupButton provides a popup menu.

add

public void add(javax.swing.JMenu submenu)
Adds a sub-menu to the popup menu.

add

public void add(javax.swing.JComponent submenu)
Adds a JComponent to the popup menu.

If the component can open popup menus of its own, for example if contains combo boxes, then you should set JComponentPopup as the popup menu before adding the component to this popup button. This will prevent the popup menu from closing automatically.

Example: 

 JPopupButton pb=new JPopupButton();
 pb.setPopupMenu(new JComponentPopup());
 pb.add(a component);

getPopupAnchor

public int getPopupAnchor()
Gets the popup anchor.

Returns:
SwingConstants.SOUTH_WEST or SOUTH_EAST.

setPopupAnchor

public void setPopupAnchor(int newValue)
Sets the popup anchor.

  • SOUTH_WEST places the popup below the button and aligns it with its left bound.
  • SOUTH_EAST places the popup below the button and aligns it with its right bound.

Parameters:
newValue - SwingConstants.SOUTH_WEST or SOUTH_EAST.
